title: How Man Utd target Moussa Dembele compares to current front three ahead of transfer window
text:

Manchester United's season has been something of a car crash to this point.

The Red Devils have lost more games than they have won, sit two points off the relegation zone and were beaten by relegation-threatened Newcastle last time out.

The most disappointing aspect from a United perspective was the fact that the club registered just three shots on target in 90 minutes against the Magpies.

In eight games the Red Devils have mustered just nine goals, less than newly-promoted clubs Norwich and Aston Villa, and are looking incredible short up top.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has been unfortunate in that Anthony Martial, Marcus Rashford and Mason Greenwood have all suffered injuries this season.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

But his decision not to replace departing duo Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez has already come back to haunt him, and you can expect him to target a striker in January.

One man who has been continually linked with a move to Old Trafford is Moussa Dembele.

Here, with the help of Wyscout, we take a look at the Lyon striker's stats compared to United's current trio of attackers: Rashford, Martial and Greenwood.

In the past calendar year Frenchman Dembele has played 57 times, Rashford 56, Martial 34 and Greenwood 13.

In this time Dembele has found the back of the net on 26 occasions, scoring nine more than Rashford in nearly the same amount of games, 13 more than Martial and 24 more than Greenwood.

Stats also show the Frenchman averages 0.62 goals per game, making him far more prolific than Rashford, who averages just 0.35.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Martial and Greenwood, meanwhile, average 0.49 and 0.34 respectively.

Dembele's expected goals stats also show the Lyon forward leading the way, with the Frenchman predicted to bag 0.55 goals per game.

Rashford, meanwhile, is expected to score 0.37 goals per game, and Martial just 0.34. Greenwood is showing more promise and is expected to score 0.55 goals per game - the same as Dembele.

In the past calendar year Dembele has had 133 shots on goal, which averages out at 3.18 per game.

United striker Rashford has fired the ball at goal 137 times, but surprisingly averages less shots on per game with just 2.82.

(Image: PA)

Martial and Greenwood have obviously played fewer games and have had 54 and 23 shots on goal in total, with a shots per game average of 2.03 and 3.91 respectively.

The stats therefore show that it is young Greenwood, on average, who is more aggressive in front of goal.

What's more the teenager has the second best shots on target percentage of all four strikers.

Of his shots on goal, 47.83 per cent have hit the target compared to 46.72 per cent of Rashford's and, worst of all, 44.36 per cent of Dembele's.

Martial ranks first in this area, hitting the target with 48.15 per cent of his shots.

(Image: PA)

Considering these stats it appears clear that both Rashford and Martial are better suited as wide forwards, while Dembele and Greenwood - who are both busier in front of goal and expected to score more often over 90 minutes - are better as front men.

This is also apparent when looking at the assist stats of each forward.

While Dembele has made four assists in 57 matches, Rashford has made nine and Martial, in just 34 matches, has made two. Greenwood, meanwhile, hasn't made any.

Both Rashford and Martial play more crosses than Dembele, while the Man United duo also complete more dribbles over 90 minutes.

In conclusion, it is obvious the Frenchman is more of a traditional forward - a man whose aim is to put the ball in the back of the net, rather than bring other players into the game in the way Rashford and Martial do.

(Image: Getty Images)

Greenwood is also this man, but is perhaps a little young at this point to lead the line on his own at Old Trafford.

It therefore seems that Dembele would be a good signing, as his killer instinct in front of goal would see him make the most of the chances both Martial and Rashford create.
description: Manchester United will get the chequebook out in January to sign a new forward - but is Moussa Dembele the right man?
